body.p: NVM Express write requests are received from the Submission Queue Manager by the Data Managers. The Data Managers break these requests in to Data Frame writes and DMA the data to be written from the host system's memory to controller memory. Requests are then issued to the Mapping Managers to write the data to flash. The Mapping Managers issue the flash write operations and reply back to the Data Managers when the write operations are complete. The Data Managers then issue completions to the host via the Completion Queue Manager. See for the complete details of this flow.
